definition: to come to blows/to paw/to grope/to get fresh
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb
foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks

sentences.english: She was watching the film, but he kept pawing at her.
sentences.chinese: 她在看電影，而他卻不斷地對她動手動腳。

sentences.english: Kim valiantly defends herself as Eli keeps coming.
sentences.chinese: 金姆勇敢地保衛自己，伊菜也繼續向她動手動腳。

sentences.english: Mary could not let any boy take liberties with her.
sentences.chinese: 瑪麗不讓男孩子對她動手動腳。

sentences.english: A: I hate guys who are no talk and all hands.
sentences.chinese: 我討厭男人不善言辭，只是動手動腳。

sentences.english: I hate guys who arn no talk and all hands.
sentences.chinese: 我討厭男人不善言辭，只是動手動腳。

sentences.english: Yet more often than not, at some point during the night Tim will begin to start touching Amanda up.
sentences.chinese: 然而提姆經常會在夜晚某個時候起對阿曼達動手動腳。

sentences.english: So do I. I like those guys who are bold but cautious.
sentences.chinese: 我討厭男人不善言辭，只是動手動腳。

to use force
sneering/sarcasm/cynical remarks
to fly into a rage out of humiliation/to be ashamed into anger (idiom)
to go into a huff
red in the face/extremely angry
fig. restless, because of fear or strong emotions
to die in such a way that sb (or sth) else also perishes/to take sb down with oneself/to end in mutual destruction
to swear while talking/to be foul-mouthed
traitor to one's love/heartless rat
to watch with amusement as sb makes a fool of himself
coward/useless scoundrel
lit. the soul of a deceased has not yet dispersed (idiom)/fig. the influence still lingers on/the spirit (of some doctrine) is still alive
to sow dissension (idiom); to drive a wedge between
lit. wind past your ear/fig. sth you don't pay much attention to/in one ear and out the other
to mix/to blend/(fig.) to spoil/to mess up things/to run around with (sb)/to get involved with/to mix (with other people)
